page.title: 19Education in Besselsleigh
page.content: Besselsleigh School is a special school for disturbed boys aged 10-16. There are 41 boys,25 resident staff and classes of 8.The boys are referred by their local clinic or social worker and come from Avon, Suffolk and Hampshire. Despite a six day working week and tests every Saturday the boys are behind in their schoolwork. They may take a few CSE's but no school examinations.There is no school uniform but the boys look alike as they wear jeans. Pets are allowed within reason; e.g gerbils, hamsters and even snakes. The school is financed by LEA and private charity funds. There are 23 acres with a swimming pool and{BMX}and motorbike tracks. Football, abseiling and Tennis are popular.
